channel.title: Comments on: Arthur Green–Radical Judaism #4 of 5
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: EW Charleston SC
item.dc:creator: EW Charleston SC
item.description: Green is a teacher but remains a "seeker" trying to place his thinking into a "silo" (heterodox) is a waste of time. None of the silos in Jewish thought has "the answer." My understanding of what Green is saying is that Judaism had and has a lot to say about the relationship of people to G-d, find what it was and is, use Knowledge from Hisory, Science, and other beliefs and seek a new (radical) Judaism.
item.content:encoded: Green is a teacher but remains a “seeker” trying to place his thinking into a “silo” (heterodox) is a waste of time. None of the silos in Jewish thought has “the answer.” My understanding of what Green is saying is that Judaism had and has a lot to say about the relationship of people to G-d, find what it was and is, use Knowledge from Hisory, Science, and other beliefs and seek a new (radical) Judaism.
